stories.text:
I am on working level in a division of around 60 people at a public institution. We are producing key sets of data, wrangling them and providing various products derived from them to colleagues downstream.

I often notice that the less "techie" colleagues of mine are dealing with a simple problem for days, wasting time.

I would like to establish a meeting of some sort where people exchange problems they are struggling with. The main point would be to exchange knowledge and in this way increase efficiency.

Example: renaming 50 files by hand. Why not write a two line program for this task?!

Does anyone have experience with this type of gathering? How do I get people to share their struggles and make them learn new ways of dealing with them?
stories.title: Ask HN: Do you have meetings to share struggles within your teams?
